.e+02
%#.0e 0.012 -> 1.e-02
%#.0e 0.12 -> 1.e-01
%#.0e 1.2 -> 1.e+00
%#.0e 12 -> 1.e+01
%#.0e 120 -> 1.e+02
%#.0e 123.456 -> 1.e+02
%#.0e 0.000123456 -> 1.e-04
%#.0e 123456000 -> 1.e+08
%#.0e 0.5 -> 5.e-01
%#.0e 1.4 -> 1.e+00
%#.0e 1.5 -> 2.e+00
%#.0e 1.6 -> 2.e+00
%#.0e 2.4999999 -> 2.e+00
%#.0e 2.5 -> 2.e+00
%#.0e 2.5000001 -> 3.e+00
%#.0e 3.499999999999 -> 3.e+00
%#.0e 3.5 -> 4.e+00
%#.0e 4.5 -> 4.e+00
%#.0e 5.5 -> 6.e+00
%#.0e 6.5 -> 6.e+00
%#.0e 7.5 -> 8.e+00
%#.0e 8.5 -> 8.e+00
%#.0e 9.4999 -> 9.e+00
%#.0e 9.5 -> 1.e+01
%#.0e 10.5 -> 1.e+01
%#.0e 14.999 -> 1.e+01
%#.0e 15 -> 2.e+01
%#.1e 123.4 -> 1.2e+02
%#.2e 0.0001357 -> 1.36e-04

-- 'g' code formatting.

-- zeros
%.0g 0 -> 0
%.1g 0 -> 0
%.2g 0 -> 0
%.3g 0 -> 0
%.4g 0 -> 0
%.10g 0 -> 0
%.50g 0 -> 0
%.100g 0 -> 0

-- precision 0 doesn't make a lot of sense for the 'g' code (what does
-- it mean to have no significant digits?); in practice, it's interpreted
-- as identical to precision 1
%.0g 1000 -> 1e+03
%.0g 100 -> 1e+02
